intro: Boscia powellii, commonly known as the Powell's boschia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often fissured bark. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Boscia powellii is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
